intro: Anarrhinum laxiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats of foliage, with small, pale green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Anarrhinum laxiflorum is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh desert environments. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
